subject: mathematics
explanation: Estimation is your secret weapon in 11+ exams! When exact calculation takes too long, smart estimation gives you the answer in seconds. Plus, estimation helps you check if your exact answers are reasonable. Master these tools: 1) Round to nearest 10/100, 2) Use benchmark numbers (25, 50, 75, 100), 3) Front-end estimation, 4) Compatible numbers, 5) Order of magnitude checks. Trust your estimates!

examples.question: Estimate 47 × 23 quickly
examples.explanation: Round both: 47 ≈ 50, 23 ≈ 20. So 50 × 20 = 1000. (Exact answer is 1081, so very close!) Always round to numbers that multiply easily.

examples.question: Estimate 897 ÷ 31 in seconds
examples.explanation: Round: 897 ≈ 900, 31 ≈ 30. So 900 ÷ 30 = 30. (Exact is 28.9, so excellent estimate!) Round divisor to factors of dividend when possible.

examples.question: Quick estimate: 68% of 291
examples.explanation: 68% ≈ 70%, 291 ≈ 300. So 70% of 300 = 0.7 × 300 = 210. Round to 200 for quick estimate. (Exact: 197.88)

examples.question: Is 15² closer to 200 or 250?
examples.explanation: 15² = (10 + 5)² ≈ 10² + 2×10×5 = 100 + 100 = 200. (Exact: 225). Or think: 15 is halfway between 10 and 20, and 10²=100, 20²=400, so 15² ≈ 225, closer to 200.
